ULID Generation Library for Java

A lightweight and easy-to-use ULID generation library

Overview

U4J is a simple and lightweight Java library for generating ULIDs (Universally Unique Lexicographically Sortable Identifiers). It provides an easy-to-use API for creating ULIDs based on timestamps, byte arrays, or strings. ULIDs are perfect for applications requiring distributed unique ID generation.

Features

  • Generate ULIDs based on the current timestamp.
  • Create ULIDs from custom timestamps, strings, or byte arrays.
  • Validate ULIDs easily.
  • Compact, lexicographically sortable, and URL-safe format.

Installation

To use U4J in your Java project, you can add it as a dependency. If you're using Maven, include the following dependency in your project:

            <dependency>
              <groupId>io.github.marvuchko</groupId>
              <artifactId>u4j</artifactId>
              <version>1.0.0</version>
            </dependency>

Quick Start

Here are some examples to help you get started with U4J:

1. Generating a ULID

import org.marvuchko.ULID;
import org.marvuchko.U4J;

public class Main {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    ULID ulid = U4J.ulid(); // Generate a ULID based on the current timestamp
    System.out.println("Generated ULID: " + ulid.asString());
  }
}

2. Generating a ULID from a Timestamp

import org.marvuchko.ULID;
import org.marvuchko.U4J;

public class Main {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    long timestamp = System.currentTimeMillis();
    ULID ulid = U4J.ulid(timestamp); // Generate a ULID based on a specific timestamp
    System.out.println("ULID from Timestamp: " + ulid.asString());
  }
}

Validating ULIDs

You can easily validate an existing ULID string or byte array using U4J:

import org.marvuchko.U4J;

public class Main {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    String ulidString = "01F4E7XJPXGDB8X5S5GTAC9B0M";
    boolean isValid = U4J.isValid(ulidString); // Validate a ULID string
    System.out.println("Is Valid ULID: " + isValid);
  }
}
